subject: Ethics
title: Automation and Job Displacement
description: A 60-second lesson on Automation and Job Displacement.

hook.text: A factory replaces 60 workers with one robotic arm. Production triples. The town's economy collapses.

buildup.text: Every industrial revolution destroyed old jobs. But AI automates cognitive work too‚Äîaccountants, lawyers, writers.

discovery.text: McKinsey estimates 800 million jobs worldwide could be automated by 2030. Not just manual labor.

twist.text: New jobs do emerge, but they require different skills. The displaced workers can't just switch overnight.

climax.text: The gap between jobs lost and jobs created is measured in human years of poverty and despair.

punchline.text: The economy adapts. Individual lives don't wait.

quiz.question: What makes AI-driven automation different from previous industrial revolutions?
options: It also automates cognitive and white-collar work
It creates more jobs than it eliminates immediately
